channel.title: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
channel.description: Hello! I have this patch consiting of a drum-machine that plays samples and also sends MIDI notes out through the DIN jack. Some of the MIDI notes needs to be delayed so I have put lots of delayed pulses everywhere in order for things to sync up properly. trum_sel_stringmux.axp (41.1 KB) Running this patch while connected via USB to a computer, say desktop PC or macbook pro, works fine. However, when running the Axoloti poweder by pretty much ANYTHING else it works for a brief second then freezes into a steady tone. I've read some posts regarding this that maybe has to do with order of execution, or that it plays the samples before they are actually fully read. The SRAM is pushed to the limits but it works while connected to PC so I'm not sure how to solve it while not connected to PC ;) Thankful for any help!

item.title: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
item.dc:creator: @servandisco servando barreiro
item.description:
@servandisco wrote:

that's interesting, have you reported that to Johannes?
Greetingzzz!
S

item.title: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Axoloti doesn't like to send midi and not have a device receiving that midi. From my experience this always crashes a patch.

The patch you posted sends out midi to the device port. When axoloti is not to a host that means you will send midi to no device --> patch will be crashing.

Read full topic
item.source: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else

item.title: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

if you are very low on sram things get fishy on axoloti. all kind of weird things can happen then. i would try to simplify some part of your patch in order to free up some sram and see if it then works in standalone mode. if it does your problem is probably sram related, if not, you'll have to dig deeper.

Read full topic
item.source: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else

item.title: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
item.dc:creator: @drsnuggles Dr Snuggles
item.description:
@drsnuggles wrote:

Hello!
I have this patch consiting of a drum-machine that plays samples and also sends MIDI notes out through the DIN jack.
Some of the MIDI notes needs to be delayed so I have put lots of delayed pulses everywhere in order for things to sync up properly.

trum_sel_stringmux.axp (41.1 KB)

Running this patch while connected via USB to a computer, say desktop PC or macbook pro, works fine.
However, when running the Axoloti poweder by pretty much ANYTHING else it works for a brief second then freezes into a steady tone.

I've read some posts regarding this that maybe has to do with order of execution, or that it plays the samples before they are actually fully read.
The SRAM is pushed to the limits but it works while connected to PC so I'm not sure how to solve it while not connected to PC

Thankful for any help!

Read full topic
item.source: Patch works on USB to computer but not powered using anything else
